definition: attack by a hidden enemy/a stab in the back
to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 hao3 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

sentences.english: Example: Such a vicious lie could be nothing but a stab in the back.
sentences.chinese: 这种恶毒的谎言简直是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: Harman claimed she was the victim of backstabbing by jealous colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 哈曼声称她是嫉妒的同事暗箭伤人的受害者。

sentences.english: He stabbed me in the back.
She takes caution for cowardice and dissent for defiance.
sentences.chinese: 她谨防懦夫的暗箭，从挑衅中挖掘异议。

sentences.english: Such a vicious lie could be nothing but a stab in the back.
sentences.chinese: 这样一种恶毒的谎言简直是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: Such a vicious lie injures people by sordid means.
sentences.chinese: 这样一种恶毒的谎言简直是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: Marshal is killed counsellor and time will, unfortunate by another quiver of attack by a hidden enemy.
sentences.chinese: 元帅杀死军师和番将，不幸被另一番将暗箭射中。

sentences.english: It was hitting below the belt to tell his wife about his extramarital affairs secretly.
sentences.chinese: 偷偷告诉他老婆他有外遇的事是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: Harman claimed she was the victim of backstab bing by jealous colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 哈曼声称她是嫉妒的同事暗箭伤人的受害者。

sentences.english: Mr. Chen's malicious remark is a stab in the back.
sentences.chinese: 陈先生的恶意评论，是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: This kind of stabbing in the back gives journalism a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 这种暗箭伤人的做法给新闻界带来了很不好的名声。

sentences.english: Accident was stab in the back, security as a shield.
sentences.chinese: 事故是暗箭，安全是盾牌。

sentences.english: Most of the criticisms hit below the belt.
sentences.chinese: 大部分批评是暗箭伤人。

definition: lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: spring-loaded arrow concealed in one's sleeve
lit. to be struck by an arrow and fall from one's horse/to suffer a serious setback (idiom)
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
